pageContext.claim: “We beat incumbents, Democrat, and almost everywhere I went, we won. But, you know, I'm one person, and the House had many races, and yet we won some great races where I went. But we won the Senate, Jeanine, we picked up two additional seats. It’s 53-47.”
pageContext.analysis: Generally speaking, Trump didn't campaign for House candidates. He more regularly campaigned for people running for statewide office. An analysis by our colleague Philip Bump showed many of the House districts Trump held rallies in did go Republican (though one previously Republican seat flipped), but he also campaigned in heavily Republican places. In other words, it's not clear how much his presence led to a Republican win.
